poem:
A New Dawn for Allergies

Invisible dread  
lurks in unsuspecting bites—  
one breath,  
a thread of life stretched thin,  
yet now, tongues might taste  
without shadows,  
as science gently remakes  
the body's silent war.  
Crisp possibility—  
in measured steps  
we draw near  
to new mornings unburdened,  
where fear no longer feasts.
